page.title: 08Garvald Parish Church
page.content: The church is pleasantly situated in a valley at the east end of the village surrounded by an old kirkyard. It is a simple T shaped sandstone building with just a belfry. The lower walls are topped by a Norman stringcourse, dating back to the 12th century. Around c.1800 three galleries were built and it seated over 500. In the 1960's it was modernised and now has attractive pink sandstone walls, light wood work and deep blue carpet, curtains and stained glass window and seats about 150. In 1980 it was no longer possible to have a resident minister and the manse was sold, however the outbuildings were retained and converted to a meeting room, vestry, kitchen & toilets. Members of the congregation made furnishings and refurbished furniture. Sunday school, kirk, & social functions are held here
